params.signature: A signature proving ownership of the node.

node(address).details: Returns the node hash for a given account's reverse records.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setName(string).details: Sets the `name()` record for the reverse ENS record associated with the calling account.

params.name: The name to set for this address.

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record.

setNameForAddr(address,string).details: Sets the `name()` record for the reverse ENS record associated with the addr provided account. Can be used if the addr is a contract that is owned by a SCW.

params.name: The name to set for this address.

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record.

setNameForAddrWithSignature(address,stri.details: Sets the name for an addr using a signature that can be verified with ERC1271.

params.inceptionDate: Date from when this signature is valid from
params.name: The name of the reverse record
params.signature: The resolver of the reverse node

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record.

setNameForAddrWithSignatureAndOwnable(ad.details: Sets the name for a contract that is owned by a SCW using a signature

params.inceptionDate: Date from when this signature is valid from
params.name: The name of the reverse record
params.owner: The owner of the contract (via Ownable)
params.signature: The signature of an address that will return true on isValidSignature for the owner

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record.

setText(string,string).details: Sets the `name()` record for the reverse ENS record associated with the calling account.

params.key: The key for this text record.
params.value: The value to set for this text record.

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record.

setTextForAddr(address,string,string).details: Sets the `text(key)` record for the reverse ENS record associated with the addr provided account.

params.key: The key for this text record.
params.value: The value to set for this text record.

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record.

setTextForAddrWithSignature(address,stri.details: Sets the name for an addr using a signature that can be verified with ERC1271.

params.inceptionDate: Date from when this signature is valid from
params.key: The key of the text record
params.signature: The resolver of the reverse node
params.value: The value of the text record

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record.

setTextForAddrWithSignatureAndOwnable(ad.details: Sets the name for a contract that is owned by a SCW using a signature

params.inceptionDate: Date from when this signature is valid from
params.key: The name of the reverse record
params.owner: The owner of the contract (via Ownable)
params.signature: The signature of an address that will return true on isValidSignature for the owner
params.value: The name of the reverse record

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record.

params.key: The text data key to query.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

clearRecords(address).notice: Increments the record version associated with an ENS node. May only be called by the owner of that node in the ENS registry.

clearRecordsWithSignature(address,uint25.notice: Increments the record version associated with an ENS node. May only be called by the owner of that node in the ENS registry.

name(bytes32).notice: Returns the name associated with an ENS node, for reverse records. Defined in EIP181.

text(bytes32,string).notice: Returns the text data associated with an ENS node and key.

userdoc.notice: A L2 reverser registrar. Deployed to each L2 chain. The contract will be verified on L1 Reverse Resolver under the namespace specified at constructor
